data.name: kstidNoMatchMsg
data.value: Finished searching the document. The search item was not found.
data.comment: Displayed in a dialog box when the user tries to find text that isn't in a view.

data.name: kstidNoMoreMatchesMsg
data.comment: Displayed in a dialog box when the program cannot find any more occurrences of a search string.

data.name: kstidFindLessButtonText
data.comment: Displayed on the More/Less button on the find/replace dialog box.

data.name: kstidCreatingWS
data.comment: Displayed in the progress dialog box when creating a new FieldWorks project

data.name: kstidCreateLangProjCaption
data.comment: Displayed in the progress dialog box caption when creating a new FieldWorks project

data.name: kstidWsPropsCloseAdvancedButtonText
data.comment: Displayed on the Advanced button on the Modify Writing System Properties dialog

data.name: kstidNoLanguageDefinition
data.value: Can't find the language definition file for '{0}'.
data.comment: Error message displayed when XML file couldn't be found.

data.name: kstidInvalidXMlFile
data.value: Can't read XML file for '{0}' - invalid XML?
data.comment: Error message displayed when XML file can't be deserialized

data.name: kstidClose
data.comment: Button text for Cancel/Close button

data.name: kstidReplaceAllDone
data.value: Finished searching the document and made {0} replacements.
data.comment: Displayed in a dialog box when a replace all has finished.

data.name: kstidReplaceAllStopped
data.value: Search stopped by user before it finished searching the document; still made {0} replacements.
data.comment: Displayed in a dialog box when a replace all has finished.

data.name: kstidStop
data.comment: Button text for stopping a replace all

data.name: kstidBuiltIn
data.comment: Button text for choosing closest writing system when disabled for built-in locale

data.name: kstidWspLabel
data.comment: Message box header for error messages.

data.name: kstidCantChangeUserWS
data.value: You cannot change the full code "{0}" of the default user writing system.

data.name: kstidUnregistered
data.comment: Displayed in HelpAbout dialog box if program is not registered

data.name: kstidErrorSavingWs
data.comment: Displayed when we catch an exception from InstallLanguage.exe

data.name: kstidNewUser
data.comment: Name displayed in the User Properties dialog list when a new user is added

data.name: kstidAutoAddEnglish
data.value: Several built-in lists have content in English only. FieldWorks is additionally creating an English writing system so that you can view the content of these lists.

data.name: kstidNotAvailable
data.value: Help is not available for this Tab.

data.name: kstidNoStyle
data.comment: First entry in style menu in Find/Replace dialog

data.name: kstidMultipleStyles
data.comment: Displayed when text box contains more than one style

data.name: kstidConfirmDelete
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete "{0}"? If you do, this account will no longer be able to access this project.
data.comment: Displayed in a message box when user tries to delete a user configuration account.

data.name: kstidDeleteLabel
data.comment: Not sure what kind of configuration this is referring to.

data.name: kstidAddPuaTitle
data.comment: The title of the PUA character dialog box when it is being used to add a new PUA character

data.name: kstidModifyPuaTitle
data.comment: The title of the PUA character dialog box when it is being used to modify a PUA character

data.name: kstidMessageIntro
data.value: Please select the appropriate custom character information.
data.comment: The first and default message the user sees.

data.name: kstidMessageWarning
data.value: Warning, you must select "false" (why do we even have a button???)
data.comment: A test warning message.

data.name: kstidPictureUnavailable
data.comment: Appended to the path of a picture if the picture file cannot be found.

data.name: kstidInsertPictureChooseFileCaption
data.comment: Caption for open file box when choosing an image file

data.name: kstidInsertPictureReadError
data.value: The selected file is not a supported image format.
data.comment: Content for message box when unable to read an image file.

data.name: kstidInsertPictureReadErrorCaption
data.comment: Caption for message box when unable to read an image file.

data.name: kstidFindMystery
data.value: The 'Find' operation failed. We've observed this before and the reasons are mysterious. If you can get it to happen repeatedly, please send the FieldWorks developers a copy of your database and the string you were searching for and tell us where the search started. Usually, the problem goes away if you just try again. That should be safe.

data.name: kstidErrorInstallingWS
data.value: The writing system could not be installed. There is a problem in your language definition. See the FieldWorks ReadMe for help in this area.

data.name: kstidCannotInstallWS
data.comment: caption for error message box

data.name: kstidErrorAccessingEncConverters
data.value: The encoding converter repository could not be accessed. A system administrator must either give your account write access to the appropriate directories, or else modify the writing system for you.

data.name: kstidOverwriteRules
data.value: Do you want to overwrite the existing collation rules (sorting)?

data.name: kstidEncoderNotAvailable
data.value: The selected encoding converter is not installed. Select a different encoding converter or create a new one.

data.name: kstidErrorInRegEx
data.comment: Displayed in a message box when an error in a regular expression occures

data.name: kstidErrorInRegExHeader
data.comment: Displayed as the message box header for a regular expression error

data.name: kstidMultipleStylesMultipleWS
data.comment: Displayed when the text box contains more than one style and more than one writing system

data.name: kstidMultipleStylesOneWS
data.comment: Displayed when the text box contains more than one style and only one writing system.

data.name: kstidMultipleWritingSystems
data.comment: Displayed when text box contains more than one writing system

data.name: kstidOneStyleMultipleWS
data.comment: Displayed when the text box contains one style and more than one writing system

data.name: kstidOneStyleOneWS
data.comment: displayed when the text box contains one style and one writing system

data.name: ksAnalWsChangedMsg
data.value: The analysis writing system list was changed in another program before you changed it here. You need to shut down all FieldWorks programs and restart them.

data.name: ksRemovingEnWsMsg
data.value:
By removing the English writing system, some of your List items, may show "***" instead of their normal contents. For this reason, it is strongly recommended that you keep the English writing system active in your project. However, if you choose to remove English now and encounter problems viewing your List items, you may add English back at any time using the Add button.
Do you want to remove English now?

data.name: ksVernWsChangedMsg
data.value: The vernacular writing system list was changed in another program before you changed it here. You need to shut down all FieldWorks programs and restart them.

data.name: ksWSPropPUAChars
data.value: Specify any custom Unicode characters needed for {0}:

data.name: ksWSPropKeyboardInstruction
data.value: Select the keyboard combination with which to type {0} text.

data.name: ksWSPropGeneralWSname
data.value: This writing system for {0} is for:

data.name: kstidCantCreateDuplicateWS
data.value: The "{0}" writing system already exists. To distinguish the new writing system you are creating from "{0}", add script, region and/or variant information.{1}{1}Alternatively, remove this new writing system and use the existing writing system, "{0}", if it meets your needs.

data.name: ksWSChangeWarning
data.value: You are changing the internal code for {0} writing systems related to {1}. This will affect every line of text in this project that uses this writing system.{2}{2}It appears that your team uses Send/Receive. Therefore, please do a Send/Receive immediately before and after making this change, and ask other teammates to stop working while you do this. If you and your teammates have not just done a Send/Receive, please click Cancel and do it now.

data.name: ksWSPropValidChars
data.value: Specify the set of valid characters for {0}.
data.comment: Label on Characters tab of Writing System Properties dialog box for setting valid characters.

data.name: kstidChangesAreLost
data.value: Any changes made in the Styles dialog have been lost due to the change in the tool.

data.name: ksMoveOrCopyToNewDir
data.value: This project links to {0} external file(s) in the previous Linked Files folder. Would you like to move or copy the file(s) to the new folder to make it easier to share and back up, along with your other project data?
data.comment: {0} is a number greater than or equal to 1 -- we aren't trying to match grammatical number here (yet)

data.name: ksMoveOrCopyFilesToLinkedFilesDir
data.value: The file(s) you have selected are not in the Linked Files folder for this project. Would you like to move or copy the file(s) to that folder to make it easier to share and back up, along with your other project data?

data.name: ksAlreadyExists
data.value: {0} already exists. Do you want to overwrite it?

data.name: ksDeletePictureBeforeReplacingFile
data.value: If you want to replace a picture file, you must first delete the current picture.

data.name: kstidDestFolderMustBeInLinkedFiles
data.value: Destination folder must be an existing subfolder of the Linked Files folder: {0}
data.comment: Error message displayed if user chooses a destination folderthat is not a subfolder of the Linked Files folder.

data.name: kstidSelectLinkedFilesSubFolder
data.value: Select a location within the Linked Files folder ({0}) for the picture file.
data.comment: Description text displayed in Browse For Folder dialog box as accessed from Picture Properties dialog box. (Parameter is path to Linked Files base folder.)

data.name: ksWSPropPunctuation
data.comment: Label on Characters tab of Writing System Properties dialog box for setting punctuation.

data.name: kstidNoTokensFoundInCurrentScriptureProj
data.value: No {0} found in the current Scripture project
data.comment: Format string for a message displayed when a scan finds no tokens in the current Scripture project. The parameter is the type of tokens sought (e.g., "punctuation patterns" or "characters"). Localizer should ensure that the text of this message corresponds appropriately to kstidCurrentScriptureProject in the FwStrings resources.

data.name: kstidNoTokensFoundInFile
data.comment: Format string for a message displayed when a file scan finds no tokens. First parameter is the type of tokens sought (e.g., "punctuation patterns" or "characters"). The second parameter is the filename that was scanned.

data.name: PunctuationPatternsScanResultsNone
data.value: The most recent scan found no new punctuation patterns.
data.comment: Displayed in label next the Scan button on the Punctuation Patterns tab of the Punctuation Usage dialog box after a scan that finds only patterns whose status is set to either valid or invalid.

data.name: PunctuationPatternsScanResultsPlural
data.value: The most recent scan found {0} punctuation patterns which are not specified as either valid or invalid.
data.comment: Displayed in label next the Scan button on the Punctuation Patterns tab of the Punctuation Usage dialog box after a scan that finds more than one pattern that does not have its status set to either valid or invalid.

data.name: PunctuationPatternsScanResultsSingular
data.value: The most recent scan found 1 punctuation pattern which is not specified as either valid or invalid.
data.comment: Displayed in label next the Scan button on the Punctuation Patterns tab of the Punctuation Usage dialog box after a scan that finds one pattern that does not have its status set to either valid or invalid.

data.name: ksNLPFolderCompressed
data.value: The Database folder ({0}) is compressed. A new project cannot be created unless the folder is decompressed. To fix this problem, close down this application and any other open FieldWorks applications. When you next launch a FieldWorks application, there will be an opportunity to fix the folder automatically.
data.comment: Warning issued instead of showing the New FieldWorks Project dialog box if the database folder is compressed. {0} is the path of the folder.

data.name: ksNLPFolderEncrypted
data.value: The Database folder ({0}) is encrypted. A new project cannot be created unless the folder is decrypted. To fix this problem, close down this application and any other open FieldWorks applications. When you next launch a FieldWorks application, there will be an opportunity to fix the folder automatically.
data.comment: Warning issued instead of showing the New FieldWorks Project dialog box if the database folder is encrypted. {0} is the path of the folder.

data.name: ksNLPFolderError
data.comment: Title for warning dialog issued instead of New FieldWorks Project dialog if the database folder is compressed.

data.name: kstidLoneDiacriticNotValid
data.value: Combining marks (e.g. diacritics) cannot be added independently as valid characters. They must be combined with valid base characters.
data.comment: Message displayed in Valid Characters dialog when user attempts to enter a single diacritic character on the Manual Entry tab.

data.name: kstidNonUnicodeFileError
data.value:
The specified file could not be read or interpreted as Unicode text.
{0}
data.comment: Content for message box reporting an error reading Unicode data from a file.

data.name: kstidOverwriteUnicode
data.value: Warning: Do not overwrite this Unicode definition unless you know what you are doing!
data.comment: Displayed at bottom of PUA Character dialog when showing an existing character.

data.name: kstidOverwriteUserCode
data.value: Warning: You are changing a definition of a custom character you've already defined.
data.comment: Displayed at bottom of PUA Character dialog when showing an existing user-defined character.

data.name: kstidErrorProjectNameTooLong
data.comment: Displayed in New FieldWorks Project dialog box if user enters a project name that results in a path that is longer than the operating system allows.

data.name: ksNLPFolderDoesNotExist
data.value: The Database folder ({0}) could not be found. If you have renamed this folder, you need to tell FieldWorks the new location. If you have moved this folder to a removable drive, you may need to connect the drive, or tell FieldWorks the new location if the system has assigned a different drive letter to it. Otherwise, this may be a sign of a corrupt FieldWorks installation; please reinstall FieldWorks or consult your system administrator. Do you want to change the Database folder now?

data.name: kstidLanguageSelectionNewWsCaption
data.value: Select Language for New Writing System

data.name: kstidIcuSortingHelp
data.value: For each code point that is out of order, add a collation rule to specify how the code point is to be ordered. For example:{0}{0} &N<ñ<<<Ñ{0} &C<ch<<<Ch<<<CH{0} &l<ll<<<Ll<<<LL{0}{0}would produce traditional Spanish collation where ñ follows n, ch follows c, and ll follows l.
data.comment: Displayed in label next to ICU sorting text box in Writing System Properties dialog. {0} is the carriage return and new line characters.

data.name: kstidMergeWritingSystems
data.value: "{0}" will be merged into "{1}", resulting in one writing system. Merging the data using this writing system could cause extensive changes to your data. We recommend that you back up your project before proceeding.

data.name: ksDirectoryLocationForBackup
data.value: Select location where you want to save your backup.

data.name: ksFindBackupFileDialogTitle
data.value: Browse for FieldWorks Project backup file

data.name: ksConfigurationSettingsRestoreDlg
data.comment: Used in the Restore dialog to refer to all kinds of configuration in FieldWorks

data.name: ksCannotSaveWritingSystem
data.value: This writing system cannot be modified, because FieldWorks does not have permission to write the necessary file ({0}).

data.name: ksWarning
data.comment: Caption for warning message box

data.name: ksChooseProjectFolder
data.comment: label for folder chooser dialog

data.name: ksCharactersNotPossible
data.comment: Note that some characters can't be included because illegal; it may also be that they can't be included because they would make the name too long.

data.name: ksCharactersNotPossibleOverwrite
data.comment: Very like the previous message, but this one is used if the destination file already exists.

data.name: ksCommentWillBeAltered
data.value: Comment will be altered in file name
data.comment: Caption for dialog

data.name: ksOverwriteDetails
data.value: The file {0} already exists. Do you want to overwrite it?

data.name: ksLinkedFilesFolderIsUnavailable
data.value: The Linked Files folder on {0} is unavailable. If you are able to re-establish the connection to this folder, do so now. You can continue using FieldWorks without access to those files.

data.name: ksLinkedFilesFolderDoesNotExist
data.value: The Linked Files folder ({0}) does not exist. Please create the folder or insert the USB drive then press Yes. Press No to use the default location.

data.name: kstidSetUpKeyboards
data.comment: Label of link to open the IBus Preferences dialog in Linux to add or configure keyboards that the user can select in FieldWorks.

data.name: kstidMemoryDiskUsageInformation
data.comment: Label of link in the About box to open the System Monitor in Linux to show information about memory and disk usage.

data.name: kstidUnableToStart
data.comment: Error message if user clicks link in About box to open the System Monitor in Linux, but the program is not able to start, probably because it isn't installed. Program name is {0}.

data.name: ksBackupErrorCreatingZipfile
data.value:
There was an error when creating the backup file for project: {0}.
The error was: {1}

data.name: ksBackupErrorRelativePath
data.value: Selected folder must be a complete path. Use Browse to find desired directory.

data.name: ksBackupCantRestoreWhenUsingSRMsg
data.value: This project cannot be restored, because it is being shared using Send/Receive. Attempting to restore a project that is shared using Send/Receive could result in data loss for everyone working on the project. If you would like to view the contents of this backup, you can restore it using a different name.
data.comment: Message shown when user attempts to restore a project that is using Send/Receive (has a local FLEx or LIFT repository)

data.name: kstidStyleContextMismatchCaption
data.comment: Message box caption shown when user adds a paragraph style and chooses a style for the following paragraph that cannot be applied in the same context (e.g., book title and footnote).

data.name: kstidStyleContextMismatchMsg
data.value: {0} cannot be the style for the following paragraph for {1} because these two styles cannot be applied in the same context.
data.comment: Message shown when user adds a paragraph style and chooses a style for the following paragraph that cannot be applied in the same context (e.g., book title and footnote).

data.name: kstidLanguageFileBrowser
data.comment: Title for the Open File dialog show in the CharContextCtrl

data.name: ofDlg_Filter
data.comment: Filter for Open/Save File dialog in ConverterTest

data.name: kstidOpenToAssociateFwProj
data.comment: Title for the Open Project Dialog when called from an external application to associate a FieldWorks project with that application

data.name: ksUnauthorizedRenameBakFile
data.value: The project {0} only exists in the form of a .bak file, and you apparently do not have file access permissions to restore it to the fwdata file. FieldWorks cannot open it. Try renaming it manually.
data.comment: Displayed if we try to open a .bak file (because there isn't an fwdata one) and the system won't allow it.

data.name: ksCantShare
data.comment: caption for ksCantShareDiffProjectFolders

data.name: ksWarningForSendReceiveLinkedFileslesPathCaption
data.value: How to change to default Linked files location

data.name: ksWarningForSendReceiveLinkedFileslesPathHelp
data.value: To change the location of Linked files to the default location, launch the FieldWorks Project Properties dialog. This can be found under the File menu, then Project Management.

data.name: ksWSWarnWhenMergingWritingSystems
data.value: Warning: You are about to merge two writing systems. If you have done interlinear analysis in both writing systems, the analyses in one of those writing systems will be lost. Do you wish to continue?

data.name: ksCouldNotBackupSomeFiles
data.value: FieldWorks was not able to back up some of the files used by this project. Do you want to keep the backup anyway? The files not backed up were {0}

data.name: DataInWsWontBeDeleted
data.value: The writing system {0} and all text in the writing system will no longer be deleted.

data.name: ksComplexFormIsComponent
data.value: The {0} you just selected as a complex or variant form of {1} is already saved as a component or variant of {1}. Which item is really a component of the other? Delete the existing relationship before trying to add this one again.
data.comment: {0} is ksEntry or ksSense. {1} is a vernacular word.

data.name: ksComponentIsComponent
data.value: The {0} you just selected as a component or variant of {1} is already saved as a complex or variant form of {1}! Which item is really a component of the other? Delete the existing relationship before trying to add this one again.

data.name: ksEntry
data.comment: Occurs as {0} in ksComplexFormIsComponent or ksComponentIsComponent.

data.name: ksSense
data.comment: Occurs as {0} in ksComplexFormIsComponent or ksComponentIsComponent.

data.name: ksWhichIsComponent
data.value: Which item is really a component?
